alert.note: Alert for Eastern Curry County and Josephine County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued November 04 at 1:43PM PDT until November 04 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: .A period of moderate to heavy rainfall is expected this afternoon and evening across the Smith River Complex burn scar. Possible thunderstorms will yield convectively enhanced rainfall rates and increase the potential for debris flows. ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE SMITH RIVER COMPLEX BURN SCAR NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate to heavy rainfall is expected to continue this afternoon and evening. There is a low probability that this heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding and/or debris flows on the Oregon side of the Smith River Complex burn scar. * WHERE...The Smith River Complex burn scar in far southwestern Josephine County and far southeastern Curry County. * WHEN...Until 8 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Moderate to heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rainfall ranging from 2 to 3 inches of rainfall over 24 hours across the Smith River Complex burn scar. Higher rainfall rates in thunderstorms will increase the threat. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Curry County and Josephine County
